title: RADS error cant connect to http server
body: Help, i cant connect to the client at all even i can play league in another laptop connected to the same network. I tried to uninstall it from the drive.  Used the internet protocol version 4 method,  replace the rads_user_kernel.exe, disabled all firewall, antivirus and anti malware program and i still cant connect to the client. Can anyone help me? LOL support is taking decades to respond. Thanks a lot

replies.body:
When they take a while to respond, that means you've reached the end of the automated responses and now they're searching for a person to actually respond to it.

Have you tried [changing DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq4) yet?

I'd like some clarity. How exactly can't you connect the client at all? At what point are you 'halted' by League (when you launch it initially, when the patcher attempts to update, when the client launches, when you attempt to find a game, when the game launches, etc.)?

What OS are you on, and who's your ISP?

The cant connect the moment i run the program, it cant open the LOL client at all.  When i run LOL, it waits for a few seconds and a black box background will surround the LOL logo (most likely stop responding) and a message will appear saying that the it cant connect to the HTTP server.  Im using windows 7 and my ISP is internode.

Have you tried port forwarding it? Go here and identify your router to find out how to configure it, and then forward ports 80, 443, 2099, 5000-5500 and 8393-8400. They should all be TCP&UDP for most likely working results, though they can all be put on only TCP, except for 5000-5500. 5000-5500 needs UDP as well as TCP.

If you need me to clarify these instructions any further, just ask!

Best of luck.
